title: Senior Finance Manager
content:
Senior Finance Manager will provide valuable guidance and support to the Finance and Client Service teams. This position will report into the SVP, Finance and collaborate with leaders on a daily basis and will be contributing to overall financial modeling and analysis during requirements planning, business reviews, and providing business insights into key initiatives.
 
Job responsibilities
Account Finance

Liaison between account and shared services on job creation, budget set up and all aspects of billing.
Review client scopes to confirm accuracy with rates, pricing, and business terms.
Maintain trackers for Purchase orders and monthly revenue
Drive monthly revenue recognition calculation
Ensure that WIP is cleared in a timely and orderly manner, client documentation/PO’s are secured, and oversees duration of the project lifecycle. Includes preparation of ETC documentation and proper revenue recognition
Manage Accounts Receivables
Provide counsel and accountability related to change order management
Help support client, internal audits and ad-hoc requests as needed
Train and ensure project management and account staff are adhering to financial

Financial Close, Budgeting and Forecasting Support

Work with local office leadership and SVP with monthly/quarterly reporting
Provide ad hoc financial data necessary for leaders to make informed decisions
Assist with Monthly P&L Analysis
Process office level revenue and expense entries for shared services
Lead quarterly forecasting discussions on assigned accounts
Provide financial insights for recurring business reviews with key stakeholders
Provide financial onboarding to staff to help educate on financial literacy.

Preferred Qualifications

7+ years’ experience (Agency/Services industry preferred)
BA/BS degree, preferable in accounting or Finance
Ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Ability to be flexible and work in a fast-paced environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Expert in excel
SAP experience highly preferred

Top Accountabilities 

Identify critical business opportunities, risks and initiatives and provide best practice financial analysis and insights to support decision making.
Identify opportunities to drive greater efficiency and effectiveness of all finance activities.
Able to interface vertically across all levels of the account team as needed
Show an eagerness to grow and learn more about the business. This includes asking questions, reading, modeling others, and being open and responsive to feedback/areas of improvement.
Exhibit professionalism and commitment to role, company and creative product.
Maintain a high level of integrity, and serve as a model for all other team
